#### Objective

The Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission’s (CNSC) Participant Funding Program (PFP) aims to enable Indigenous peoples, members of the public, and stakeholders to participate in the CNSC’s regulatory decision-making process. The program provides funding to eligible recipients for matters related to CNSC-regulated facilities and activities.

#### Background

The PFP is an essential component of the CNSC’s decision-making process. An independent Funding Review Committee (FRC) examines all PFP applications and makes recommendations to the CNSC on funding amounts and objectives.

#### Task and Deliverables

The selected contractor will be required to:

* Attend FRC meetings
* Review PFP applications and relevant background materials
* Develop recommendations on individual funding amounts and objectives
* Contribute to drafting and signing an FRC Recommendations Report

#### Mandatory Requirements

The contractor must:

* Have experience in government, at a director level or higher, with expertise in reviewing environmental and impact assessment projects, federal participant funding programs, and solving regulatory issues
* Not be employed by the Public Service of Canada or any other levels of government
* Not have any business or personal ties to project proponents or PFP applicants

#### Justification for the Selected Supplier

The CNSC has pre-selected Colette Spagnuolo as the contractor due to her extensive experience in environmental and impact assessment, regulatory issues, and Indigenous consultation.

#### Contact Information

Inquiries and statements of capabilities should be directed to: `solicitation-demandedesoumission@cnsc-ccsn.gc.ca`

#### Pre-Selection Criteria

The CNSC reserves the right to pre-select a supplier based on their experience, expertise, and availability.
